channel.title: Mastodon Home Timeline
channel.description: RSS feed for the Mastodon Home timeline

item.title: Teixi
item.description:
@emilygorcenski Similarly just listened @kordinglab about how having more real data beats bayesian stats, general purpose algos beats `my model` approaches... ;)Aka: The Bitter Lesson in ML!~54 min.
https://learnbayesstats.com/episode/84-causality-neuroscience-psychology-konrad-kording/

item.title: Prof. Mayank R Mehta, UCLA
item.description: Brenda Milner did a lot more pioneering work than you'd guess (see article). Remarkably, most of it is still useful after 60+ years! She will be 105 on July 15. Award committees, now is your chance to recognize her pioneering work and send her a great birthday gift.https://www.frontiersin.org/articles/10.3389/fnhum.2021.786167/full

item.title: MaggieCi
item.description: a salad-related tale

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: Must read for anybody interested in data forensics. Excel spreadsheets (unsurprisingly) contain a mass of historical information. If the data were tampered with in the same file, there may well be a trace.I suspect a few applications of this sort of analysis will be showing up on PubPeer soon.https://datacolada.org/109

item.title: Keith Devlin
item.description: #Brexit insanity. This looks like pure spite. She is my age (76) and the UK was her home since she was 2 years of age. What the hell has gone wrong with my home country? https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2023/jun/17/norwegian-roxy-music-album-cover-star-kari-ann-moller-fights-to-stay-in-uk-post-brexit

item.title: Zack Labe
item.description:
So much heat. Temperature anomalies over the last three months:üü• - warmer than average
üü¶ - colder than averageQuestions about GISTEMPv4 and the baseline (1951-1980): https://data.giss.nasa.gov/gistemp/faq/. Code for the data: https://data.giss.nasa.gov/gistemp/sources_v4/

item.title: Scott Stedman
item.description: Saud al-Qahtani‚Äôs public reappearance, with hugs and kisses from Bin Salman‚Äôs inner circle, should give every American official pushing for rapprochement with Saudi Arabia pause. Al-Qahtani was the mastermind and intelligence chief of the Khashoggi assassination. The celebration of his return from nearly 5 years of hiding is disgusting, cruel, and a gigantic F you to to Blinken, who just left Saudi Arabia last week.

item.title: Thiago Carvalho
item.description: "For at least two centuries, scientists have been enthralled by the ‚Äúzombie‚Äù behaviors induced by mind-controlling parasites. Despite this interest, the mechanistic bases of these uncanny processes have remained mostly a mystery."https://elifesciences.org/articles/85410

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: I've never understood how the standard French mortgage has a fixed rate for its duration whereas in the home of fintech (the UK) such an offering is impossible.https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2023/jun/18/millions-are-facing-soaring-mortgage-rates-how-did-we-leave-them-so-vulnerable

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: Oh. I just realised that Robert F. Kennedy Jr is running for the *Democratic* nomination. Is his plan then to switch to being independent and drag as many voters as possible with him?

item.title: Alex Holcombe
item.description:
Big publishers' journals are not to be admired.Meta-psychology and a few other scholar-led journals do computational reproducibility checks of all submissions.
Do ANY non-scholar-led journals (e.g., owned by the big publishers) do this?
If not, I rest my case! üòÜ

item.title: Miriam Jacobs
item.description: @Myndex @lambo Then go where the algorithms are. Honestly, the whole fediverse does not have to be the same. If you want your content searchable, by all means produce for an algorithm. Leave the rest of us alone.

item.title: MPI for Biol. Intelligence
item.description: Groundbreaking science, published in prestigious journals: Ilaria Vitali and Johannes Kappel receive the Young Scientist Award for their outstanding scientific publications! Read more about their research: https://www.bi.mpg.de/news/2023-06-ysa#youngscientistsaward #maxplanck #maxplanckinstitute #scicomm #wisskomm #neurobiology #zebrafish #scienceaward #research #science #ScienceMastodon

item.title: Grace Lindsay
item.description:
I'm hiring a postdoc! If you'd like to work on a research project that fits into either of these two research areas (https://lindsay-lab.github.io/research/) then send a CV, half page project proposal & contact info for 3 references to grace.lindsay@nyu.edu with subject "Postdoc Application"
#neuroscience

item.title: Justin Elliott
item.description: Our latest story on the Supreme Court:Justice Samuel Alito Took Luxury Fishing Vacation With GOP Billionaire Who Later Had Cases Before the Court https://www.propublica.org/article/samuel-alito-luxury-fishing-trip-paul-singer-scotus-supreme-court
